item.title: Well Documented
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Documentation is easy to understand. It will take you step by step through theme installation. Easy website set up and managing with organized user guide included with Whole.

item.title: Powerful Elements
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole is packed with a large collection of awesome, beautiful and innovative elements, Whole will help you create your website easily in simple, fun, and fast steps.

item.title: Amazing Layouts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole is full of great and awesome predesigned inner pages, as well as portfolio, blog, and shop layouts. All of this ensures you can set up a fully functional website in no time.

item.title: Unlimited Layouts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole based on in-depth research into business field, to deliver all layouts and blocks you need. Whole has been optimized to give visitors the best experience in terms of UX/UI.

item.title: Custom Fonts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Customizing your website is easy with Whole. Thanks to the powerful user friendly options panel, which allows you to customize almost anything in the appearance of your website.

item.title: WooCommerce Ready
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole compatible with the awesome WooCommerce plugin so you can easily create and manage your online store and start selling right away. Be sure Whole provide all your needs!

item.title: Social Media Integration
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole provides integrated social media sharing options, as well as widgets that let you easily display your Twitter and Instagram feeds directly on your website.

item.title: High Speed Performance
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole is using the best code practices and top quality code to ensure fast loading time and clean code. Being packed with a lot of features, the code is optimized for best performance.

item.title: Enhanced User Experience
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Whole based on in-depth research into business field, to deliver all layouts and blocks you need. Whole has been optimized to give visitors the best experience in terms of UX/UI.

item.title: Powerful Theme Options
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Customizing your website is easy with Whole. Thanks to the powerful user friendly options panel, which allows you to customize almost anything in the appearance of your website.

item.title: Accordions & Toggles

item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1490372182108{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_empty_space height="105px"][cms_heading subtitle="Free Your Creative Side!" title="Best Solutions For Business" description="We are Whole business, our strategists will help you set an objective and choose your tools, developing a plan that is custom-built for your business. item.title: PSD Box Mockup
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
After all, as described in Web Design Trends 2015 & 2016, vision dominates a lot of our interpretation of world around us. On top of that, pleasing images create a better user experience. Rounding up a bunch of specific designs and talking about the merits of each is the perfect way to find common ground. Collecting a wide array of samples and inspiration is a great way to start your next awesome project. At its core, every brand has something special to reveal something that inspires people. We are a branding agency, this plan if you plan to create a small portfolio or busines showcase for you studio or business company.
League is not just about graphic design; it's more than that. We offer integral communication services, and we're responsible for our process and results. We thank each client and their projects; thanks to them we have grown and built what we are today!
Our agency can only be as strong as our people and because of this, our team have own businesses, designed game changing products, consulted for companies and competed collegiately.

We are a branding agency, this plan if you plan to create a small portfolio or busines showcase for you studio or business company.
League is not just about graphic design; it's more than that. We offer integral communication services, and we're responsible for our process and results. We thank each client and their projects; thanks to them we have grown and built what we are today!
Our agency can only be as strong as our people and because of this, our team have own businesses, designed game changing products, consulted for companies and competed collegiately.

item.title: New subway line has the most advanced technology world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Blue Monday, which falls on 18 January in 2016, is allegedly the most depressing day of the year. Understandably, tightened purse strings following the festive splurge, time passed since Christmas and failed new year resolutions is not a combination for happiness – but why is the third Monday in January apparently the worst day of the year? The theory was first published in 2005 a press released under the name of Cliff Arnall, who at the time was a tutor at the Centre for Lifelong Learning – a Further Education centre associated with Cardiff University. Later, however, the Guardian printed a statement from the university distancing itself from the psychology professor: "Cardiff University asked us to point out that Cliff Arnall... was a former part-time tutor at the university but left in February.
The third Monday of January is supposed to be the most depressing day of the year. Whether you believe that or not, the long nights, cold weather and trying to keep to new year resolutions are all probably getting to you a little by now.
So how can you make today – and the rest of January – a little better for you and your wallet? Well, if times are tight, a little extra in your pocket should make the month more bearable. Here are four easy ways to do just that. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month. The sales are still on, and with the temperatures dropping there’s probably the temptation to kit yourself out in a new jumper or winter coat. Well if you’ve got some old woollies down the back of the wardrobe, there’s a good chance your friends do too. Getting a group of you together to swap clothes means you’re getting a new look for free, adding some extra pounds to your purse to save or spend elsewhere. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month."

Como Gelar A Cerveja Rápido
Preste atenção nessa informação, porque eu testeii ela num churrasco essde término de semana, e também fiquei bastante satisfeito! Aliás, um agradecimento próprio aao Guiga ( @filhodopadeiro ) do Tudo Sobre Facebook , que me passou esse conhecimento milenar!
A medida de todo um desses ingredientes dependerá da quantidade de cerveja que se pretende gelar. Porém comumente, serria umm saco de gelo, uum litro de água, um l de álcool e também meio quilo de sal. Após colocar todos os ingredientes num recipiente, basta aacomodar as latas/garrafas de cerveja e esperar por retornamento de 3 minutos. Você poderá proporcionalizar essas medidas conforme a quantidade de cerveja que pretende gelar.
sal se dissolve acilmente na água e também reduz seu marca de congelamento. Pura, a água congela a respeito de 0 ºC. Já a chuva com sal precisa dee uma temperatura menor, que é possível que chegar a dezenas de graus abaixo de zero. Enquanto sal é colocado no gelo, secção dos cubos derretem, roubando” calor durante a troca de estado físicoe esfriando a mistura como um todo.
Além disso, sal dissolvido provoca uma reação endotérmica, ou melhor, reduz mas a temperatura da mistura. álcool possui um papel semelhante: derrete gdlo roubando” calor e diminui ainda mas marca de frigoríficação. É empregado poque enquanto a temperatura permanecer menos -9 ºC, sal perde algo do efeito, porém álcool não.
De olho no relógio: alumínio é bom condutor de calor, e 3 minutos são suficientes para quue as latinhas mergulhadas encontrem equilíbrio térmico. Como a temperatura fica menos zero, depois poucos minutos, a licor vai estar tão gelada que não vai dar para sentir paladar e também periga congelar. Deixe toalha de papel absorver bem a água, e prontamente, leve as cervejas para frigorífico. A água no papel vai gelar rápida, formando umaa camada de gelo quee esfria a poção.
Orientação: tomem zelo, pois dependendo do freezer a cerveja é possível que gelar numa rapidez absurda, deixando sua cerveja congelada, que não é lícito. Mini Refrigerados USB Maiis um gadget alcoólico para você não perder a maré de tomar uma cervejinha geladésima no recreio do seu trabalho. Há nem tinha visto… a do nitrogênio é a melhor (moleza de localizar) hahahahahha excelente. adicionei aos favoritos…. E também que pergunta ali em cima do Leandro.
Não funciona com outrras bebidas não, só cerveja que gela, as outras se colocar esquenta! http://cervejeiromestre.com.br/cerveja/como-gelar-mais-rapido/

item.title: Four ways to cheer yourself up on the Next Blue Monday!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Blue Monday, which falls on 18 January in 2016, is allegedly the most depressing day of the year. Understandably, tightened purse strings following the festive splurge, time passed since Christmas and failed new year resolutions is not a combination for happiness – but why is the third Monday in January apparently the worst day of the year? The theory was first published in 2005 a press released under the name of Cliff Arnall, who at the time was a tutor at the Centre for Lifelong Learning – a Further Education centre associated with Cardiff University. Later, however, the Guardian printed a statement from the university distancing itself from the psychology professor: "Cardiff University asked us to point out that Cliff Arnall... was a former part-time tutor at the university but left in February.
The third Monday of January is supposed to be the most depressing day of the year. Whether you believe that or not, the long nights, cold weather and trying to keep to new year resolutions are all probably getting to you a little by now.
So how can you make today – and the rest of January – a little better for you and your wallet? Well, if times are tight, a little extra in your pocket should make the month more bearable. Here are four easy ways to do just that. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month. The sales are still on, and with the temperatures dropping there’s probably the temptation to kit yourself out in a new jumper or winter coat. Well if you’ve got some old woollies down the back of the wardrobe, there’s a good chance your friends do too. Getting a group of you together to swap clothes means you’re getting a new look for free, adding some extra pounds to your purse to save or spend elsewhere. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month."

item.title: Purple Ice Cream Packaging
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
After all, as described in Web Design Trends 2015 & 2016, vision dominates a lot of our interpretation of world around us. On top of that, pleasing images create a better user experience. Rounding up a bunch of specific designs and talking about the merits of each is the perfect way to find common ground. Collecting a wide array of samples and inspiration is a great way to start your next awesome project. At its core, every brand has something special to reveal something that inspires people. We are a branding agency, this plan if you plan to create a small portfolio or busines showcase for you studio or business company.
League is not just about graphic design; it's more than that. We offer integral communication services, and we're responsible for our process and results. We thank each client and their projects; thanks to them we have grown and built what we are today!
Our agency can only be as strong as our people and because of this, our team have own businesses, designed game changing products, consulted for companies and competed collegiately.

item.title: Don’t miss Top Things To Do In San Francisco
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Blue Monday, which falls on 18 January in 2016, is allegedly the most depressing day of the year. Understandably, tightened purse strings following the festive splurge, time passed since Christmas and failed new year resolutions is not a combination for happiness – but why is the third Monday in January apparently the worst day of the year? The theory was first published in 2005 a press released under the name of Cliff Arnall, who at the time was a tutor at the Centre for Lifelong Learning – a Further Education centre associated with Cardiff University. Later, however, the Guardian printed a statement from the university distancing itself from the psychology professor: "Cardiff University asked us to point out that Cliff Arnall... was a former part-time tutor at the university but left in February.
The third Monday of January is supposed to be the most depressing day of the year. Whether you believe that or not, the long nights, cold weather and trying to keep to new year resolutions are all probably getting to you a little by now.
So how can you make today – and the rest of January – a little better for you and your wallet? Well, if times are tight, a little extra in your pocket should make the month more bearable. Here are four easy ways to do just that. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month. The sales are still on, and with the temperatures dropping there’s probably the temptation to kit yourself out in a new jumper or winter coat. Well if you’ve got some old woollies down the back of the wardrobe, there’s a good chance your friends do too. Getting a group of you together to swap clothes means you’re getting a new look for free, adding some extra pounds to your purse to save or spend elsewhere. You can make some quick cash by switching your bank account to one with a bonus. Some banks are giving away £150 for moving your custom, while others offer cashback or high interest. Of course it’s worth checking you won’t lose out in other ways such as high overdraft fees. If you’re likely to go into the red you might be better off switching to a bank with lower fees or even a small interest free overdraft. What’s up in the loft? Or under the bed? If you aren’t sure it probably means you don’t need it – and that’s a sign you should try to sell it. If there’s the potential for it to be rare or part of a collection it’s worth seeking specialist advice. Otherwise head to a boot fair or list it online. Just don’t forget to factor in costs such as postage or fees. The are more tips in our step-by-step guide to selling online below. Just click through the slides. Did you decide to stop smoking this year? Or was it drinking for a month? Whatever your resolution don’t just think about the health benefits as it could also be helping your bank balance. The average smoker lights up 12 cigarettes a day, adding up to nearly £150 in January. Having five less pints of beer or glasses of wine each week could easily save you £100 this month."
